meanings.definition: A series of short, high-pitched sounds made by birds or insects.
meanings.sent1: The chirrups of the birds filled the morning air with music.
meanings.sent2: I love waking up to the chirrups of crickets on summer nights.
meanings.sent3: The chirrups of the crickets sounded like a tiny orchestra playing in the grass.
meanings.sent4: The chirrups of the birds were like nature's own lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The chirrups of the insects created a symphony of sounds in the garden.

meanings.definition: To make a series of short, high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: The little bird chirrups happily in the tree.
meanings.sent2: She chirrups a cheerful tune while skipping down the path.
meanings.sent3: The kitten chirrups for attention whenever someone enters the room.
meanings.sent4: The old radio chirrups to life, playing a nostalgic song from the past.
meanings.sent5: As the wind blew through the trees, it seemed to chirrup a secret message.
